docs.title: GKIT Digital Signage App
docs.text: Welcome to the GKIT Digital Signage App documentation! This platform provides a modern, multi-tenant digital signage solution specifically designed for golf clubs.

docs.title: 🎯 Overview
docs.text: The GKIT Digital Signage App is a cloud-native, Firebase-powered application that allows golf clubs to display dynamic content on screens throughout their facilities. Built with React and TypeScript, it offers a flexible widget system and customizable slide layouts.

docs.title: ✨ Key Features
docs.text:
• 🔥 Firebase-Powered: Real-time updates using Firestore
  • 🎨 Customizable Layouts: Multiple slide layouts (Fullscreen, Sidebar, Grid)
  • 🧩 Widget System: Modular widgets for tee times, weather, news, and more
  • 🏢 Multi-Tenant: Single codebase, multiple clubs
  • 📱 Responsive: Works on any screen size
  • 🔐 Secure Admin: Protected admin dashboard for configuration
  • ⚡ Real-Time: Live content updates without page refresh

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text:
Get started in 3 simple steps:

  1. Clone the repository 

    git clone https://github.com/Owe-S/GKIT-DigitalSignage-APP.git
cd GKIT-DigitalSignage-APP

  2. Install dependencies 

    npm install

  3. Configure Firebase

  4. Update services/firebaseConfig.ts with your Firebase credentials

  5. Set USE_FIREBASE = true

  6. Run locally 

    npm run dev

Visit Getting Started for detailed instructions.

docs.title: 🏗️ Architecture
docs.text:
The app follows a modern, scalable architecture:

  • Frontend: React + TypeScript + Vite
  • Database: Firebase Firestore
  • Authentication: Firebase Auth
  • Hosting: Firebase Hosting
  • Deployment: GitHub Actions (optional)

Learn more in the Architecture section.

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.text: Understanding the GKIT Digital Signage App architecture.

docs.title: Frontend
docs.text:
• React 18 - UI library
  • TypeScript - Type safety
  • Vite - Build tool and dev server
  • React Router - Client-side routing
  • Lucide React - Icon library

docs.title: Backend Services
docs.text:
• Firebase Authentication - User management
  • Cloud Firestore - NoSQL database
  • Firebase Hosting - Static file hosting

docs.title: Development Tools
docs.text:
• ESLint - Code linting
  • TypeScript Compiler - Type checking
  • MkDocs - Documentation

docs.title: 1. Screens
docs.text: A Screen represents a physical display device. Each screen has: - Unique ID - Club association - Collection of slides - Configuration metadata

docs.title: 2. Slides
docs.text: A Slide is a single view that rotates on a screen: - Layout type (Fullscreen, Sidebar, Grid) - Duration (seconds) - Collection of widgets - Transition effects

docs.title: 3. Widgets
docs.text: Widgets are modular content blocks: - Type (tee times, weather, news, etc.) - Configuration - Data source - Render logic

docs.title: 4. Layouts
docs.text: Layouts define widget arrangement: - Fullscreen: 1 large widget - Sidebar Right: Main + 3 sidebar widgets - Grid 2x2: 4 equal-sized widgets

docs.title: Display Page Flow
docs.text:
User visits /screen/:id
    ↓
DisplayPage fetches config from Firestore
    ↓
Screen configuration loaded
    ↓
Slides render one-by-one
    ↓
Widgets fetch their data
    ↓
Auto-rotation based on duration

docs.title: Admin Panel Flow
docs.text:
Admin logs in
    ↓
Firebase Authentication
    ↓
Dashboard shows all screens
    ↓
Admin selects screen to edit
    ↓
Screen Editor loads config
    ↓
Admin makes changes
    ↓
Save to Firestore
    ↓
Display updates in real-time

docs.title: State Management
docs.text:
The app uses React's built-in state management:

  • Component State (useState) - Local UI state
  • Effect Hooks (useEffect) - Side effects and data fetching
  • Props - Data passing between components
  • Firebase Real-time - Server state synchronization

No external state library (Redux, MobX) is needed for this application size.

docs.title: Routing Strategy
docs.text:
React Router with Hash Routing for compatibility:

<HashRouter>
  <Routes>
    <Route path="/screen/:screenId" element={<DisplayPage />} />
    <Route path="/admin/login" element={<LoginPage />} />
    <Route path="/admin/dashboard" element={<DashboardPage />} />
    <Route path="/admin/screen/:screenId" element={<ScreenEditorPage />} />
  </Routes>
</HashRouter>

Hash routing ensures proper navigation even on simple hosting.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
• Firebase Auth handles user identity
  • Google sign-in or email/password
  • JWT tokens for API requests

docs.title: Authorization
docs.text:
• Firestore security rules enforce access control
  • Public read for display screens
  • Authenticated write for admin operations

docs.title: Data Validation
docs.text:
• TypeScript ensures type safety
  • Firestore rules validate data structure
  • Client-side validation in forms

docs.title: Horizontal Scalability
docs.text:
• Each club gets isolated data
  • Firebase auto-scales
  • CDN distributes assets globally

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
• Code splitting (lazy loading)
  • Asset optimization (Vite)
  • Firestore indexes for fast queries
  • Local caching where appropriate

docs.title: Deployment Guide: New Club Setup
docs.text: This guide explains how to use your Master Git Repository to launch the Digital Signage App for a new client (Golf Club).

docs.title: Concept
docs.text:
• Git Repository: Contains the Generic Template (White-label code).
  • Google Cloud: Each club gets its own Project (isolated database, hosting, and billing).

docs.title: 1. Get the Code
docs.text:
Open your terminal and clone your master repository (if you haven't already): 

git clone <YOUR_GIT_REPO_URL> new-club-project
cd new-club-project

docs.title: 2. Create New Google Cloud Project
docs.text:
1. Log in to Google Cloud Console.
  2. Create a New Project (e.g., oslo-gk-display).
  3. Important: If you are using owe-admin@golfklubb-it.com, create it under your own Organization or "No Organization" to avoid the skigk.no restrictions.

docs.title: 3. Configure the App for the New Club
docs.text:
1. Create Firebase Config:
    • Go to Firebase Console -> Add Project (select the one you just created).
    • Register a Web App.
    • Copy the firebaseConfig keys.
  2. Update Code:
    • Open services/firebaseConfig.ts and paste the NEW keys.
    • Open services/api.ts and update createDefaultConfig with the new club's name (e.g., "Oslo Golfklubb").

docs.title: 4. Deploy
docs.text:
# Login to the new project
firebase login
firebase use --add
# Select the new project ID (e.g., oslo-gk-display)

# Deploy
npm run build
firebase deploy

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: You do not need to rename the old project. The Git Repository is your "Source of Truth". You simply pull from it, customize the config for the new club, and deploy to a new cloud project.

docs.title: Deployment Overview
docs.text: Learn how to deploy the GKIT Digital Signage App to production.

docs.title: Deployment Options
docs.text:
The app can be deployed to:

  1. Firebase Hosting (Recommended) - Fast, global CDN
  2. Google Cloud Run - Container-based deployment
  3. Vercel/Netlify - Alternative static hosting

docs.title: Why Firebase Hosting?
docs.text: ✅ Optimized for Firebase apps ✅ Global CDN - Fast worldwide ✅ Free SSL certificates ✅ Simple deployment with CLI ✅ Custom domains supported ✅ Automatic HTTPS redirect

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Firebase project created
  • Firebase CLI installed
  • Project configured (see Configuration Guide)

docs.title: Step 1: Install Firebase CLI
docs.text: npm install -g firebase-tools

docs.title: Step 2: Login to Firebase
docs.text: firebase login

docs.title: Step 3: Initialize Firebase (if not done)
docs.text:
firebase init

Select: - Hosting (use spacebar to select) - Choose your project - Build directory: dist - Single-page app: Yes - GitHub deploys: Optional

docs.title: Step 4: Build the App
docs.text:
npm run build

This creates optimized production files in the dist/ folder.

docs.title: Step 5: Deploy
docs.text:
firebase deploy --only hosting

You'll see output like: 

✔  Deploy complete!

Project Console: https://console.firebase.google.com/project/your-project/overview
Hosting URL: https://your-project.web.app

docs.title: Add Your Domain
docs.text:
1. Go to Firebase Console → Hosting
  2. Click Add custom domain
  3. Enter your domain (e.g., display.yourclub.com)
  4. Follow DNS verification steps
  5. Add the provided DNS records to your registrar

Firebase will automatically provision SSL certificates.

docs.title: Deployment Checklist
docs.text:
Before deploying to production:

  • [ ] Update Firebase config with production keys
  • [ ] Set USE_FIREBASE = true
  • [ ] Configure Firestore security rules
  • [ ] Enable Firebase Authentication
  • [ ] Test all features locally
  • [ ] Build succeeds without errors
  • [ ] Set up custom domain (optional)
  • [ ] Configure monitoring/analytics

docs.title: Development
docs.text: npm run dev  # Uses local config

docs.title: Production
docs.text:
npm run build  # Creates optimized build
firebase deploy  # Deploys to hosting

docs.title: GitHub Actions
docs.text:
Create .github/workflows/deploy.yml:

name: Deploy to Firebase Hosting

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  build_and_deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '20'

      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm run build

      - uses: FirebaseExtended/action-hosting-deploy@v0
        with:
          repoToken: '${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}'
          firebaseServiceAccount: '${{ secrets.FIREBASE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT }}'
          channelId: live
          projectId: your-project-id

docs.title: Firebase Analytics
docs.text: Enable in Firebase Console: 1. Go to Analytics 2. Click Enable Analytics 3. Choose data sharing settings

docs.title: Error Monitoring
docs.text:
Consider adding Sentry:

npm install @sentry/react

Configure in main.tsx: 

import * as Sentry from "@sentry/react";

Sentry.init({
  dsn: "your-sentry-dsn",
  environment: "production"
});

docs.title: Rollback
docs.text:
If you need to rollback a deployment:

firebase hosting:channel:deploy previous-version

Or restore from Firebase Console → Hosting → Release history.

docs.title: Build fails
docs.text: Check: - Node version (must be 18+) - Dependencies installed correctly - No TypeScript errors

docs.title: Deploy succeeds but app shows errors
docs.text: Check: - Firebase config is correct in production - Firestore security rules allow reads - Authentication is configured

docs.title: Slow loading
docs.text:
• Ensure Firebase Hosting is used (global CDN)
  • Check bundle size: npm run build -- --report
  • Consider code splitting for large apps

docs.title: Configuration Guide
docs.text: Learn how to configure the GKIT Digital Signage App for your golf club.

docs.title: Setting Up Firebase
docs.text:
1. Create Firebase Project (if not already done)
  2. Visit Firebase Console
  3. Click "Add project"

  4. Follow the wizard

  5. Add Web App

  6. In project overview, click Web icon (</>)
  7. Register app with a nickname

  8. Copy the firebaseConfig object

  9. Update services/firebaseConfig.ts

export const firebaseConfig = {
  apiKey: "AIzaSyXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX",
  authDomain: "your-club-id.firebaseapp.com",
  projectId: "your-club-id",
  storageBucket: "your-club-id.firebasestorage.app",
  messagingSenderId: "123456789",
  appId: "1:123456789:web:xxxxxxxxxxxx"
};

export const USE_FIREBASE = true;

Security

Never commit real API keys to public repositories!

docs.title: Enable Firestore Database
docs.text:
1. In Firebase Console, go to Build → Firestore Database
  2. Click Create database
  3. Select location (choose closest to your users)
  4. Start in Test mode for development

docs.title: Configure Firestore Security Rules
docs.text:
Update your Firestore rules for production:

rules_version = '2';
service cloud.firestore {
  match /databases/{database}/documents {
    // Screens collection - public read, authenticated write
    match /screens/{screenId} {
      allow read: true;
      allow write: if request.auth != null;
    }

    // Users collection - authenticated only
    match /users/{userId} {
      allow read, write: if request.auth != null && request.auth.uid == userId;
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Enable Authentication
docs.text:
1. Go to Build → Authentication
  2. Click Get Started
  3. Enable sign-in methods:
  4. Email/Password (recommended)
  5. Google (optional)

docs.title: Default Club Settings
docs.text:
Edit services/api.ts to set your club's default data:

const createDefaultConfig = (id: string): ScreenConfig => ({
  id: id,
  clubId: 'your-club-id',
  clubName: 'Your Golf Club Name',
  clubUrl: 'yourclub.com',
  slides: [
    // ... your default slides
  ],
  updatedAt: new Date().toISOString()
});

docs.title: Environment Variables (Optional)
docs.text:
For production, consider using environment variables:

Create .env.local: 

VITE_FIREBASE_API_KEY=your-api-key
VITE_FIREBASE_AUTH_DOMAIN=your-app.firebaseapp.com
VITE_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID=your-project-id

Then modify firebaseConfig.ts: 

export const firebaseConfig = {
  apiKey: import.meta.env.VITE_FIREBASE_API_KEY,
  authDomain: import.meta.env.VITE_FIREBASE_AUTH_DOMAIN,
  // ... etc
};

docs.title: Available Widgets
docs.text:
The app includes these built-in widgets:

  • GOLFBOX_TEE_TIMES - Display tee times
  • WEATHER_YR - Weather forecast
  • NEWS_RSS - News feed
  • GOLFBOX_TOURNAMENTS - Tournament list
  • MANUAL_OFFER - Custom promotions

docs.title: Customize Widget Data
docs.text:
Mock data is defined in services/api.ts. For production, connect to real APIs:

export const getMockTeeTimes = async () => {
  // Replace with real API call
  const response = await fetch('https://your-api.com/teetimes');
  return response.json();
};

docs.title: Creating a New Screen
docs.text:
Screens are stored in Firestore under the screens collection.

Example screen document: 

{
  "id": "clubhouse-entrance",
  "clubId": "your-club",
  "clubName": "Your Golf Club",
  "clubUrl": "yourclub.com",
  "logoUrl": "https://yourclub.com/logo.png",
  "slides": [
    {
      "id": "slide-1",
      "layout": "SIDEBAR_RIGHT",
      "duration": 15,
      "widgets": [
        {
          "id": "w1",
          "type": "GOLFBOX_TEE_TIMES",
          "title": "Today's Tee Times"
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "updatedAt": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
}

docs.title: Slide Layouts
docs.text: Choose from: - FULLSCREEN - Single widget, full screen - SIDEBAR_RIGHT - Main content + right sidebar (3 widgets) - GRID_2X2 - 4 widgets in a grid

docs.title: Vite Configuration
docs.text:
The build is configured in vite.config.ts:

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [react()],
  build: {
    outDir: 'dist',
    sourcemap: false
  }
});

docs.title: Firebase Hosting
docs.text:
Configure hosting in firebase.json:

{
  "hosting": {
    "public": "dist",
    "ignore": ["firebase.json", "**/.*", "**/node_modules/**"],
    "rewrites": [
      {
        "source": "**",
        "destination": "/index.html"
      }
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: Complete installation guide for the GKIT Digital Signage App.

docs.title: Minimum Requirements
docs.text:
• OS: Windows 10+, macOS 10.15+, or Linux
  • Node.js: Version 18.0 or higher
  • RAM: 4GB minimum
  • Storage: 500MB free space

docs.title: Recommended
docs.text:
• Node.js: Version 20.x LTS
  • RAM: 8GB or more
  • Browser: Chrome, Firefox, or Edge (latest versions)

docs.title: 1. Install Node.js
docs.text:
If you don't have Node.js installed:

Windows/macOS: Download from nodejs.org

Linux (Ubuntu/Debian): 

curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_20.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs

Verify installation: 

node --version
npm --version

docs.title: 2. Clone the Repository
docs.text:
Using HTTPS: 

git clone https://github.com/Owe-S/GKIT-DigitalSignage-APP.git

Using SSH: 

git clone git@github.com:Owe-S/GKIT-DigitalSignage-APP.git

Navigate to the project: 

cd GKIT-DigitalSignage-APP

docs.title: 3. Install Project Dependencies
docs.text:
npm install

This installs: - React and React DOM - React Router - Firebase SDK - TypeScript - Vite (build tool) - Lucide React (icons)

docs.title: 4. Verify Installation
docs.text:
Run the development server: 

npm run dev

You should see output like: 

VITE v5.1.4  ready in 432 ms

➜  Local:   http://localhost:5173/
➜  Network: use --host to expose
➜  press h + enter to show help

docs.title: Optional: Install MkDocs (for documentation)
docs.text:
If you want to build/edit documentation locally:

pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material

Build docs: 

mkdocs build

Serve docs locally: 

mkdocs serve

docs.text:

  • Configuration
  • Deployment

docs.title: npm install fails
docs.text:
Solution: Clear npm cache and retry: 

npm cache clean --force
npm install

docs.title: Port 5173 already in use
docs.text:
Solution: Kill the process or use a different port: 

npm run dev -- --port 3000

docs.title: Permission errors on Linux/macOS
docs.text:
Solution: Don't use sudo. Fix npm permissions: 

mkdir ~/.npm-global
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'
echo 'export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get your GKIT Digital Signage App up and running in minutes!

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have:

  • ✅ Node.js 18+ installed
  • ✅ npm or yarn package manager
  • ✅ A Google Cloud / Firebase account
  • ✅ Git installed

docs.title: Step 1: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/Owe-S/GKIT-DigitalSignage-APP.git
cd GKIT-DigitalSignage-APP

docs.title: Step 2: Install Dependencies
docs.text:
npm install

This will install all required packages including: - React 18 - React Router DOM - Firebase SDK - Lucide React (icons) - TypeScript

docs.title: 3.1 Create a Firebase Project
docs.text:
1. Go to Firebase Console
  2. Click Add Project
  3. Enter project name (e.g., your-club-display)
  4. Follow the setup wizard

docs.title: 3.2 Register Web App
docs.text:
1. In your Firebase project, click the Web icon (</>)
  2. Register app name
  3. Copy the firebaseConfig object

docs.title: 3.3 Update Configuration
docs.text:
Open services/firebaseConfig.ts and replace the placeholder values:

export const firebaseConfig = {
  apiKey: "YOUR_ACTUAL_API_KEY",
  authDomain: "your-project.firebaseapp.com",
  projectId: "your-project-id",
  storageBucket: "your-project.firebasestorage.app",
  messagingSenderId: "YOUR_SENDER_ID",
  appId: "YOUR_APP_ID"
};

export const USE_FIREBASE = true; // Set to true

docs.title: 3.4 Enable Firestore
docs.text:
1. In Firebase Console, go to Firestore Database
  2. Click Create database
  3. Choose Production mode or Test mode
  4. Select a location

docs.title: Step 4: Run Locally
docs.text:
npm run dev

The app will start on http://localhost:5173

Visit http://localhost:5173/screen/demo-screen-1 to see the display!

docs.title: Step 5: Access Admin Panel
docs.text:
Navigate to http://localhost:5173/admin/login

Default Mock Credentials (if Firebase auth not configured): - Email: admin@example.com - Password: Any password (mock mode)

Pro Tip

For production, always enable Firebase Authentication and set proper security rules!

docs.text: Solution: Verify that USE_FIREBASE = true and your config keys are correct.
